snippet: The Miss Albany Diner, near the Capitol, is a historic fixture, quirky and popular. Yet it is closing.
abstract: Miss Albany Diner, a fixture of the New York State capital since 1941, is closing; patrons have filled the downtown diner since the unexpected announcement; quirky diner, which is on the National Register of Historic Places as an example of mid-20th-century roadside architecture, is closing because owner Jane Brown, 77, wants to retire.
lead_paragraph: The Miss Albany Diner, near the Capitol, is a historic fixture, quirky and popular. Yet it is closing.

headline.seo: Miss Albany Diner, a Landmark, Is Closing
headline.main: Throwback in Albany Will Serve Last Meal
headline.print_headline: Throwback In Capital Will Serve Last Meal
